sense.name: portions of legal ownership in a corporation
sense.examples: Our company had to sell stock to raise money. John's stock has doubled in value this year.

sense.name: inventory or supply of a product
sense.examples: That hardware store has an interesting stock of tools. The sofa I wanted was out of stock. They will cut round stock to 1-inch diameter. Just use basic stock to make copies of this photo.

sense.name: domesticated animals kept for use or profit
sense.examples: The drought has reduced the output of our dairy stock. This stock of goat has soft, long hair. Arabians are a hardy equine stock.

sense.name: handle of a tool or gun
sense.examples: The rifle had been fitted with a special stock. He grabbed the pool cue by the stock.

sense.name: flowering plant species
sense.examples: Is that flowering plant a Malcolm stock? Mary says these flowers are called either 'gillyflower' or 'stock'.

sense.name: structural part of a plant
sense.examples: He said even the French vines now use California root stock. You should trim back your roses' stock every fall.

sense.name: broth or rich cooking liquid
sense.examples: You need to roast the vegetables first when making a brown stock. Great sauces begin with great stocks.

sense.name: lineage or bloodline
sense.examples: Mary said her grandmother came from hardy pioneer stock. These puppies come from good German Shepherd stock.

sense.name: repute or regard
sense.examples: Let's take stock of the situation. They wonder whether he has enough stock to win that election.

sense.name: neckcloth, kerchief
sense.examples: She fastened the white stock at her throat with a pin.

sense.name: production and plays performed by a theatrical company
sense.examples: The stock for Lincoln Theater Group this summer was all Shakespearean tragedy.
